results.title: Warrah
results.brief_description: Warrah was filmed in the coastal sandstone bush of the Hawkesbury River area in NSW. It is a film of rock, foliage, angophoras, rock pools, the movement of shadows, light reflected from water and reflections of trees and clouds in rock pools. The soundtrack of this 3-colour separation film is an unaltered recording of insects and choruses of kookaburras.

results.title: Warping mill
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Weaving”.
Shows how weaving warps that are longer that six metres in length can be made on a warping mill.

results.title: Warp and weft
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Betty Brunke
results.brief_description: Weaving, one of man’s oldest arts, still offers pleasure and opportunity for self-expression to both beginner and expert. We watch a class of weavers, under expert guidance, “dress” their looms and weave the useful and attractive articles of their choice, a delicate evening scarf, fabric for a suit, or the practical table mats woven by a beginner. The process of weaving is seen in close-up and slow motion. Traditional Scottish and European designs are shown with excellent contemporary work from every part of Canada, indicating the popularity of the craft today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Betty Brunke

results.title: Warner in the wild
results.creator_credit: Greenway Films, Wendy Campbell and David Gray
results.brief_description: Follows the band “Dave Warner From the Suburbs” as it tours around the far northwest of Australia, suffering the heat and hardships of such a trip. Incorporates some of Warner’s most popular songs as well as providing comments by Warner as to the content of his lyrics, which portray suburban living and the Australian character, as no other Australian songwriter has done. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Warming up
results.brief_description: The intense atmosphere generated by members of an orchestra in the last five minutes before going on stage. The film makes an analogy between the mechanics of the human body and that of the musical instruments, the instruments seem equally alive as their players - only the performance they are about to share matters.

results.title: Warming by the devil's fire
results.creator_credit: Charles Burnett, Alex Gibney, Margaret Bodde, Reverse Angle International and Vulcan (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Blues Collection = Martin Scorsese presents The Blues a musical journey [DVD]”.
Part of Martin Scorsese’s “The Blues Collection”. Kidnapped by Uncle Buddy, on his way to be saved from the devil by being baptised, a young 11 year-old boy gets a life education on exactly what it is he is going to be ‘saved’ from. Through a re-telling of this young boy’s journey travelling the Deep South, his education becomes the viewers’ with a narration (by Carl Lumbly) of the boy as an adult recalling this past he will never forget. The history of the African American musician is his lesson, starting out in New Orleans and the blues music that stemmed from early 1900 to the 1940s turns into, as the director says, a ‘story that gives you the impression of the blues’. Inserted in the ‘educational’ narrative is a combination of archival footage of the period, original performances and stills. The influence of the church and gospel music is covered and the work also includes details of female performers whose powerful music and voices transcend time and place, such as Bessie Smith, Victoria Spivey, Ma Rainey, Dinah Washington and Sister Rosetta Thorpe. Others featured include Willie Dixon, Sonny Boy Williamson, Son House, John Lee Hooker and Muddy Waters amongst many others. Cast includes Tommy Redmond Hicks and Nathaniel Lee Jr. with an original score by Stephen James Taylor.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Burnett, Alex Gibney, Margaret Bodde, Reverse Angle International and Vulcan (US)

results.title: Warm strangers
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Melanie Coombs and Ivan Sen
results.brief_description: At the end of his journey, Jess attempts to reunite with his father whom he has not seen for years. Powerful short from the director of ‘Beneath Clouds’ (2002), Produced by Melanie Coombs (‘Harvey Krumpet’). Original format 16mm/black and white.

results.title: Warm nights on a slow moving train
results.creator_credit: Western Pacific Films, Ross Dimsey, Patric Juillet and Bob Ellis
results.brief_description: Wendy Hughes plays an art teacher employed at a Catholic girls’ convent school from Monday to Friday. At weekends she rides the overnight express train between Sydney and Melbourne as a prostitute in order to keep her addict brother supplied with morphine. Every week she changes her appearance, mannerisms, and personality, luring male clients who always pay and leave by 3 a.m. However, an intelligence agent (Colin Friels) becomes her lover and they team up to murder a politician on the train. Wendy Hughes exudes sensuality, power and passion in the lead role.
results.title_for_label: Warm nights on a slow moving train
results.creator_credit_for_label: Western Pacific Films, Ross Dimsey, Patric Juillet and Bob Ellis

results.title: Warlords II for Mac
results.material_description: Floppy disk videogame. Four 3 1/2 inch floppy disks, registration card, subscription card, catalogue and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Warlords II refines on the formula that made the previous game so successful. New to the game is the addition of “fog of war”, where enemy units may be concealed from the map if a player’s own units are not close enough to see them. The interface and graphics have been upgraded and a suite of tools have been added to facilitate its multiplayer experience. This include a play by e-mail feature, a random map generator and a map editor.

results.title: Warlords II for DOS
results.material_description: Floppy disk videogame. Two 3 1/2 inch floppy disks, registration card, subscription card, catalogue, advert, reply paid envelope and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Warlords II refines on the formula that made the previous game so successful. New to the game is the addition of “fog of war”, where enemy units may be concealed from the map if a player’s own units are not close enough to see them. The interface and graphics have been upgraded and a suite of tools have been added to facilitate its multiplayer experience. This include a play by e-mail feature, a random map generator and a map editor.
results.description: Warlords II refines on the formula that made the previous game so successful. New to the game is the addition of “fog of war”, where enemy units may be concealed from the map if a player’s own units are not close enough to see them. The interface and graphics have been upgraded and a suite of tools have been added to facilitate its multiplayer experience. This include a play by e-mail feature, a random map generator and a map editor.
description_for_label: Warlords II refines on the formula that made the previous game so successful. New to the game is the addition of “fog of war”, where enemy units may be concealed from the map if a player’s own units are not close enough to see them. The interface and graphics have been upgraded and a suite of tools have been added to facilitate its multiplayer experience. This include a play by e-mail feature, a random map generator and a map editor.
